content.description: Do a low sit start on the far right arete which trends left. Start with your left hand on a low, small sidepull and your right hand on the low, slopey ramp feature. Power up to a sloper on the arête. Then move left and up on marginal slopers staying true to the arête.
content.location: This problem is on the first big boulder you encounter from the trail.

content.description: Sit start the left-trending arête. Start matched on the creaky crimp plate.
content.location: This ascends the far right arete about 6-7 feet right of the problem Breach of Contract.

content.description: Sit start the 70 degree overhanging prow with your left hand on a low, flat crimp and your right hand on an obvious, lower edge/crimp bar. Power up to a left hand crimp. A few more crimpy moves lead to a slopey topout.
content.location: This problem is roughly located in the center of the small boulderfield.

content.description: Sit start the steep arête. Start on crimps, and make a crux move to the decent left hand knob. Move up to slopers, and top out. This problem does not use the slopey right slab for your feet.
content.location: This is the likely first problem you will come to from the trail. It has a slopey slab pedestal which also may help identify it.

content.description: Low sit start on the right leaning arête/cylinder. Move up to two decent slopers and then transition to a cool crimp bar match and reach for the lip and top out.
content.location: This boulder is somewhat hidden in a grove of Cedar trees.

content.description: These are a small collection of small to medium-sized blocks with a handful of problems. All these problems are located within a 200 yard radius of each other.
